meanings.sent1: The oppugnant team fought hard to win the game.
meanings.sent2: Her oppugnant attitude made it difficult to work together.
meanings.sent3: The cat's oppugnant refusal to take a bath was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The oppugnant storm clouds loomed ominously in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The oppugnant mountain stood tall, blocking their path.

meanings.definition: A person who opposes or resists
meanings.sent1: The oppugnant at the meeting voiced their concerns loudly.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the oppugnant in the debate club.
meanings.sent3: The little oppugnant in the family always stood up against unfair rules.
meanings.sent4: The oppugnant in the story was the hero who stood up to the villain.
meanings.sent5: The oppugnant's determination inspired others to speak up too.
